website_summaries.verdict: This form-fitting case instantly conforms to the body and lens of a DSLR camera.
pros: Consists of neoprene with reinforced stitching, ensuring the case can serve you well for an extended period of time
Offers a spacious interior to provide lots of room for camera batteries, memory cards and other accessories
Comes with a built-in carabiner that enables you to attach the case to your belt during photo shoots
cons: May be too small for some Nikon and Canon DSLR cameras

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful lightweight stylish case.
customer_reviews.text: Really cute case. It did have like this manufactured odor at first but I sprayed some febreze and am letting it air out so I'm sure it will be fine. It fits my Canon T6i perfectly and looks like it offers good protection and is lightweight. The back pocket fits a spare battery and a spare SD card as well. The camera strap comes out nicely with the case so that it can be used easily. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sushma Trivedi

customer_reviews.title: This camera bag is a perfect fit for my Canon Rebel T6i
customer_reviews.text: This camera bag is a perfect fit for my Canon Rebel T6i. The neoprene is thick enough to protect my camera when tossed into my purse, and I can rest easy knowing my camera is safe. I love the little zipper pocket; I can fit my memory card and extra battery in it. My only complaint is the piece of material they constructed my bag from does not really match the colors in the stock photo. My bag has a lot of brown, mustard yellow, and dark orange striping rather than the cute pink, royal blue, and turquoise striping that the stock photo has. Not an issue though; construction wise I give this product 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Nikon D3400 perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for my Nikon D3400 DSLR. Works fine for the 18-55 mm standard lens. I might be to small for larger DSLR cameras. The D3400 is quite small and it fits snugly. Check your own camera's measurements against the D3400 to be sure it fits. This case is best for transporting the camera with some protection but not good for taking it on and off for active picture taking. With that in mind, I like the case and love the pattern. I get lots of favoralbe comments on it. The small zipper pocket is good for a lens cleaning cloth but that about it. A spare battery fits but very tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Great slim case, but not all that userful of a pocket
customer_reviews.text: This 'case' is exactly what I was looking for. Slim protection for the camera body and lens, that smooshes down enough to stuff in a pocket. It fits my Olympus OM-D E-M5 MKII + 12-40 pro lens perfectly. The only reason I dock a star is because the pocket it has is quite smallish. The pocket stretches out just holding a single battery, so it's more for an sdcard or something...and with 128GB+ sdcards who really needs that? I would have given it 5 stars if the pocket was a little bigger and could fit two batteries.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I got really excited because that was exactly what I was looking for. When the item arrived I was disappointed with the quality. The stiches are very poorly done and it does not look like they will last. The case looks like it’s lopsided and even though my camera fit I couldn’t close the back. Moreover, I ordered the stripped one and the one I got is completely different than the one pictured. It is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Fiva

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: One Size DOES NOT fit all !!
customer_reviews.text: It's not honest to Publish a large list of "Works with" cameras in the Product Description, including big ones such as the FX Nikons D810, D750, D610, and then find out that the sleeve is WAY TOO SMALL to fit it in. This sleeve will only work (for size reasons) with small entry-level DSLRs with not too long lenses (not more than a 18-55mm aprox). However, the idea is good as a secondary and light bag to protect the camera during shooting breaks, or if you just don't want to carry your big bag with lenses, accessories, etc. THEY JUST NEED TO MAKE IT IN SEVERAL SIZES !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dunno what I was thinking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this along with a new nikon d3300 camera. Quickly realized this wasn't what I needed. It looks nice and it does protect the camera. There just is enough room to hold the camera with the lens attached. Only short lenses though. A 55-200 won't fit. It's also quite awkward to get the camera out of its hanging around your neck. Forget any accessories. They're not going with you. Going back to get the large Amazon dslr camera bag. That's going to be much more useful.
customer_reviews.author: DTrueblood.FleshwoundTattoo

customer_reviews.title: Barely fits D750
customer_reviews.text: This seems too small for my Nikon D750. The flash mount is putting a lot of pressure on it so I think it will wear quickly in that spot. And the loop & hook just reaches enough to be secure (see pictures). This is due entirely to the height of the camera body and has nothing to do with the lens. All in all, it will work to store my camera in a carry on bag rather than bringing my large camera bag, but I don't think I'll use it for carrying around on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Kali H.

customer_reviews.title: Fluffy, Protective, Clean design, and good price.
customer_reviews.text: I love it! its so fluffy and protects my camera from any damage! Its very fluffy and protective. The design is VERY WELL DONE and the quality of it is very clean and nice too. ALL my friends love the design for the flower one( one I got). Its over all very smooth and I just love it. Definitely buy it if you are looking for a nicely designed camera case with very protective layer. However, obviously, if you drop it, you will break or damage your camera but you are safe from any scratches! I actually took it to the Disneyland and it did its job in the crowd.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect quick access case
customer_reviews.text: Used this case for the first time yesterday for my Canon T6. It fits perfectly inside the case and doesn't cause a lot of bulk, but I still feel the camera is well protected. In a non-crowded area, the clip is perfect to keep the case outside of a bag and have quick access to my camera. I wanted a case I could use for the camera inside a day bag that wasn't a traditional camera case. This was the perfect solution!! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: The minimalist approach to travel!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a minimalist approach to carrying your camera and not looking like a tourist either. The improved flex armor is feels a bit sturdier than its counterpart that is still sold. While I love the camera holster the protection isn't perfect because the Velcro on the bottom isn't entirely a piece of mind and neither is the key clip on the bottom. While it does feel enough to protect from scratches and bumps, a fall could actually break off he lens attached. It is quite feather weight but I do think it could use with some extra thicker padding for some protection and piece of mind for a improvement. The price is fair too.
customer_reviews.author: Gamer02

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute camera case, looks exactly as pictured! I have a Nikon D3400. It fits in perfectly with my 50mm lens and hood. I keep the hood on mostly for extra scratch protection and I was glad I wouldn't have to remove it to fit the camera in the bag. Only downside is I was hoping the zipper compartment on the back would be large enough to hold business cards. Unfortunately it isn't, but otherwise I love it!
customer_reviews.author: LTMW

customer_reviews.title: A little too small for a camera with 17-40mm lens
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it along with a matching polka dots camera strap for my Canon 80D with 17-40mm lens L series and it is tight! The velcro closure almost didn't meet/lock from end to end. The looks are great but if you have a lens longer than 40mm, you will be disappointed like me. I went back to my old neoprene case that I ordered here years ago. I didn't bother returning this one. I'll just use it as a back up case for as long as I don't attach the zoom lens to my camera. Lastly, make sure to air it out after unboxing it because the 'brand new' smell of this material is pretty potent... for days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good for storing...
customer_reviews.text: this is great for extra padding. For me, I like the old style where you can keep the body covered when using but slip over the lens and top of camera when you're not. I took this hiking. too much hassle to take camera in and out with all the picture taking. I kept if off for most of the hiking. It is good if you're going to throw your camera in a bag other than a good camera bag. it was enough protection to put the camera in my big travel purse without having to worry about it. I used it with my EOS 60D and an 18-55 lens. that's about as long of lens as could fit
customer_reviews.author: Kat KC

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking and backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time outdoors and purchased my Canon T6 Rebel with the intent of taking it with me camping/hiking/backpacking. This cover won't protect against big drops, but it works great for stowing in your pack when you're not carrying a full camera case, or for carrying around your neck as you scrammble through rough terrain and want to have the camera ready in a moments notice. I wouldn't say the case is waterproof, but could probably take a few drops of rain until you find shelter or store the camera in a more protective case. In the end, super glad I purchased this--it's brought a lot of peace of mind to my outdoor photography excursions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FIT SONY A7II W/ 24-105MM
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to using this product but the item does not fit my Sony A7II with my 24-105mm lens on the body. Since this is the lens I use the majority of the time, I have no use for it. and returned this item. If you plan on buying this, your camera ought not to be larger than the Sony Alpha series and your lens no longer than any kit or shorter prime lens. Overall, the product quality looked nice if your camera set up is smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Jay4life

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my niece, who only wanted a camera for her sweet 16. Because she’s still a beginner, I didn’t want to invest too much in a camera bag, strap, etc. without knowing whether she’d stick to it. This bag is perfect and well made at its price point. I also purchased its matching bag and smaller camera case. The colors are vibrant and the gift was so cool to her that she both called and sent me a text message to say thank you and how much she loved it. (Double thank you’s? In teenage speak, that means the gift was an absolute hit!)
customer_reviews.author: Candi

customer_reviews.title: This can protect your camera
customer_reviews.text: This is nice to protect your camera if you want to place it in a backpack without having to carry a camera bag around. I am disappointed that you can't keep the lens hood on the camera as there is just enough room for a standard lens and camera body. It does have a tiny little pocket on the back, but not sure what it would be used for as it is not large enough for anything. I don't think I would recommend this product - a standard case would be the best way to go. I gave it 3 stars for the water proof material and quailty of the way it was made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon 60D fits
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip via airplane. I didn't want to use my camera bag as a carry on. My camera did fine in this sleeve, tucked into my backpack. When going through security, I didn't have to take the sleeve off since I leave the camera strap on the outside of the sleeve. I have a Canon 60D with a pancake 24mm f/2.8; it fits with "lens room" to spare. The 18-200mm f/3.5-5.6 does not fit. The buckles in the photos attach to my camera strap.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I came across this sleeve
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nikon D7100 and the sleeve just fits over the camera body. As some other reviewers have stated, the top flap is just a little too short to cover the body and Velcro shut, making the pocket unusable. Personally, I didn't intend to use the pocket, so the sleeve works for me. I have a smaller lens on my camera right now, but there is definitely room for a large lens. I'm glad I came across this sleeve, as I often just grab my camera and head out the door, which just sits unprotected on my car seat. At least with the sleeve on, i feel like there is a little more protection for my camera.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: I should have its own strap for holding while using the camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had this case for a few days but the seller requested a review. I will update my review after I go on a trip soon. I like the case, it's just as pictured/promised. I understand that it has a belt strap, but, let's face it, I'm not going to use that ever (and, ehem, I don't wear belts). So I think that the product should have a hand strap or something because once you remove the camera from the case, you have a case in your hand with nowhere to put it. Hope this is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Gemma

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight solution to prevent scratching your DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Great idea that really works well, perfect when your expensive camera is carried in a backpack alongside a bunch of other stuff. Seems to well made . Used it on my Nikon D7100 with 16-80mm, tight fit but does cover the the camera and lens well, but you have to stretch the rear flap over more than I would like so the velco grabs . Wont fit the full frame DSLRs so wish there was choice of larger sizes. My friends are asking! Leave the large camera bag at home when you are on a trip..
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Keep searching
customer_reviews.text: Very snug and VERY difficult to squeeze my Nikon D3200 DSLR camera into it. I don’t think the camera would fit in this with a lens any larger than a 16-85mm and even that is probably pushing it. That’s the size lens on my camera and the strap can hardly close to velcro shut. I’m going to return the product. It’s just not practical and takes too much effort to squeeze my camera into it. I honestly have no clue how this product has as many good reviews as it does. I’m very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Good DSLR Sleeve
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my dslr camera to protect it when I am walking with it hanging around my neck so that if it bumps into anything it is protected and won't scratch. Took it on vacation with me and it works like a charm! Only gave it 4 stars because the velcro is so strong that when I'm opening the sleeve I get nervous that the velcro will pull out of its stitching. Also the sleeve is a little annoying if you are taking it off and putting it on again quickly. But overall a great product; just bought one for my friend because I love mine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel protection to throw in backpack (or carabine clip on)
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my vacation where I didn't want to travel/hike with an entire camera bag set up. Picture here is my Canon T6 w/ Sigma 17-50mm lens (and Peak strap w/ QD plate). It just fit with this setup, the bulkiest of my setup (it also fit with my 55-250mm Canon lense (that is longer but skinnier). Great for peace of mind minimal protection while stashed in backpack. The carabine loop felt sturdy and secure, I had no concern using that. The zipper bag was nice for an extra card, but would't fit a battery (with this setup). I am satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: F. Todd

customer_reviews.title: solid case
customer_reviews.text: i really like this for when I dont want to carry the camera backpack and wont need extra lenses or anything. i wanted to just put the camera in this case in my bag and go. my cannon eos 90d really doesnt fit though. it would be hard to get in and out frequently, like I wanted. i have to fold bottom over on itself and shove and fold back and really stretch the closure of it. bummer. otherwise it seems like a great case.
customer_reviews.author: A. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Good scratch protection; snug fit
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. I bought this to have something to protect my camera when I want to throw it in a backpack or something rather than carry all my gear. It will work fine for that and offer some drop protection, though I don't think it would do much for a drop of more than a foot or so. The fit is pretty tight even with the standard kit 18-55 lens on my t6i. No way I could fit it with my 55-250 on it. The tight fit can make it a little more difficult than it needs to be to get your camera in and out but I'll take too much protection over not enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jay W

customer_reviews.title: Very cute and keeps camera safe
customer_reviews.text: Been using for over a year now. Love this sleeve, never dropped my camera with it so I’m not sure if it’s very protective but it gives me complete peace of mind when my camera is in a bag with other things. I like how easily it comes off when I want it off but it stays on when I want it on. Stores nicely into a bag. I wish there was some way to attach it to something because when I take it off it just goes in a bag, If I don’t have a bag, just gotta keep it in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for International Travel
customer_reviews.text: I use this in addition to my camera case when traveling but for day trips or excursions when you don't want to lug your whole case around, this offers a decent amount of protection. If i could change one thing it would be a velcro cap over the lease so you could shoot without having to take the camera out of the case since it is hard to hold a camera and hold this case. I think I could make one for mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, flexible
customer_reviews.text: Great, flexible, basic travel case. I use this on trips where I don't want to take a heavy-duty case. It is a thin lining so probably wouldn't protect well from drops. For putting in a bag that gets bumped a bit it works great though! The one thing I would change (and why there are 4 stars) is that it'd be nice if there was a flap on the front too so that you don't have to entirely remove the camera from the case to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Meryl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I've had these things for my cameras since I still used a 35mm SLR. They're great for when you don't want a whole kit or large, obvious camera bag with you. This one fits a Canon T1i with a smallish zoom lens like a glove. If you have something like a 70D or other higher end large DSLR, this case won't fit. Smaller DSLR's are fine, as long as the lens isn't big. The little zippered pocket on the back is good for a lens cap or a SD card or two.
customer_reviews.author: MPH

customer_reviews.title: Great protection with minimal bulk
customer_reviews.text: These are great for keeping your camera protected when you don’t feel like lugging around the whole Camera bag. I used to just wrap my camera in like a dish towel and throw in my purse so I was extremely happy when I found this. It’s great when I want to take the camera places like Disneyland and the beach and want to reduce bulk whenever I can. I have purchased this for multiple members of my family that also have the dslr cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Megan N.

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional
customer_reviews.text: I love the design. This fits my Nikon Coolpix B500 with some extra room so would definitely fit a full size DSLR camera. I love it because I can just put my camera in my purse and don't have to worry about it getting scratched up. Then when I transfer it to my actual camera bag the sleeve is thin enough I don't even have to remove it to fit the camera in the bag. I have only had it for a little while so I can't comment on durability yet but it seems pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Sam C

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking cover for my DSLR. I use it when I travel somewhere but have to leave my real camera bag at home (think in my carry on). It is a bit stretchable; so, I can squeeze it onto my Canon T6i with the 18-135mm lens (barely). The next size up is probably more appropriate though. There is no way it will fit the Canon 24-105mm lens. Overall I am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RobNordic

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to a full camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Protected my DSLR camera from bumps in my carry-on. Fit my Canon EOS Rebel with 18-35mm lens. Not sure it could have fit my camera with the zoom lens attached, so take that into consideration. If you want a layer of protection in a carry-on or backpack, this would be a good option. When I wasn't using the camera sleeve, it squashed down nicely to fit in a bag.
customer_reviews.author: hchurch

customer_reviews.title: Great protective cover
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Nikon d3400 to use when the kit lens is attached. It fits well, the Velcro holds it securely and I like the zippered pocket which is big enough to hold a lens cloth and an extra memory card. I also have the larger version of this cover which I use when I have a zoom lens attached. It provides protection for the camera and lens when it is in a backpack while touring.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fits Canon Rebel T2i perfectly but needs attachment to camera strap
customer_reviews.text: It fits my Canon Reble T2i perfectly and I fell that it provides good cushioning. I wish it had a string or cable that can attach to your camera strap because when you remove the case you have to just leave it on the ground or hold it in your had while you shoot. I'll have to add one but that's an additional cost to me.
customer_reviews.author: SD GUY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great size, fits my Sony A6300 perfectly with room left over for the extra battery. Sponge like padding is great so you can throw it into another bag/backpack and keep it safe. True to size and the velcro close is awesome instead of a silly zipper to screw with. Bought another one with zipper on the other major site and it is junk. This one if perfect. Just pull the camera straps out and perfect easy use. Also has a clip for your belt/backpack. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: A bit tight for my Nikon D3500 with lens.
customer_reviews.text: It is a snug fit for my D 3500. I have to really pull it shut to make sure the Velcro strips line up securely. It is very roomy along the sides of the lens (18-55 mm). But I suppose that provides more protection. The little pocket is okay for the spare battery but once again it is snug. I may opt to stash the battery inside. Much handier to carry around than my big camera case with the other lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Wilkie

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for Sony A7-3
customer_reviews.text: Works with my kit lens perfectly, and I have used it also with my 24-600 lens, though the scotch hooks and loops does not reach. If this 1 inch of elasticity it would. The hasp is a fantastic idea, I use it to attach the case to the camera strap when using the 24-600 lens, or to my pants belt loop when I take the cover off for shooting comfort. Protects from elements and normal knocking around, great price.
customer_reviews.author: ShapAmos

customer_reviews.title: Good protection, but....
customer_reviews.text: This provides good protection and fits my Nikon D3300 w/ a 35mm prime lens perfectly. The negative is you have to completely remove it in order to take a picture. In hindsight, I guess that should have been obvious, but I missed that in the description and I wish I'd made a more careful purchase. However, I'm keeping it as it fits perfectly, is great quality and a terrific value. I'd definitely repurchase from this seller and also other items of this brand. The "oops" here is totally mine.
customer_reviews.author: Spokane Executive

customer_reviews.title: It’s Still Early Yet But Seems To Be A Great Case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Canon Rebel SL2 & so far I’ve seen nothing that would lead me to believe this won’t hold up . It’s well put together, provides good padded protection, and is relatively easy to get the camera in & out. If I have an early concern it would be on how well the Velcro lock will stay together over time. This case is probably what you’re looking for.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Little small for my Sony a7iii with Tamron 28-75mm 2.8
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Sony a7 iii with Tamron 28-75mm 2.8 but it is little small. I kept it anyway and after a couple weeks of use and stretching the material it's finally fitting much better. But there is no room for an extra battery in the back pocket. I use the back pocket for a cleaning cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and Protective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take on my first flight with my new camera (Panasonic Lumix FZ1000), and it was great. It's super colorful and noticeable just like the picture, and I got so many compliments on it as I wandered around the city taking pictures. It would be nice if I could just pop the end off and take pictures, or loop it onto the strap so I didn't have to stuff it in a pocket or bag while taking pictures, but then again there are other options for that if you want it. Soft but durable neoprene, and protective enough I could just throw it in my carryon/backpack and not have to worry about it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Willis

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit Canon 6D
customer_reviews.text: This would be a 5 star review if it actually fit my camera. I can barely squeeze my Canon 6D with a 50mm lens into this. I’m keeping it because even if it won’t completely close, it’s better than just tossing my uncovered camera into my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Fits Canon t6i with 135mm lens and universal tripod mount
customer_reviews.text: So I only just got this but am very pleased that it does what I need it to do. I have a Canon t6i with universal tripod mount attached and 135mm lens, and it fits! NOW...its a very tight fit and if it wasn't Neoprene it might NOT work, but I am able to stretch it just enough to close the velcro closures...I rated 4 out of 5 stars on durability and ease of use because I'm not sure if it will last stretched out so much and it IS a bit of a struggle pulling it tight enough to close the velcro but that's not a fault of the product but MY use of it
customer_reviews.author: b06efj

customer_reviews.title: A good option for packing your camera in something other than a camera specific bag, but be sure to reinforce one weak point.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good option for breaking free from your camera specific bag. We like to use day hiking bags when we travel and this provides just enough protection to pack the camera in with other similarly protected gear. Unfortunately, this sleeve case has one major drawback. There is no reinforcement where the hotshoe mount rubs against the inside of the sleeve. After only a few trips, it has already rubbed through and would soon become unusable if left alone. I still recommend this sleeve, but I suggest you apply a piece of thick tape to the inside of the sleep where the hotshoe mount meets it. I'm using a Nikon D600 and the fit is great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Camera Accessory
customer_reviews.text: This case is perfect for my Nikon D5600. It's not so tight that you couldn't squeeze something in there if you needed to like cash, an extra SD card or battery, it's stretchy and not hard to get on and off the camera, it's thick and padded so it makes you feel ok about putting it into a backpack, and the stitching is great quality. I'm a new photographer but I'd say this is my favorite accessory I've bought so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Too big for Canon M50
customer_reviews.text: I loved this case, however, it's much too large for the Canon EOS M50, even with a larger lens on it. For a larger DSLR camera, it would probably be perfect though. I wish it would have worked.
customer_reviews.author: karapg

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel photography
customer_reviews.text: I got this to protect my camera when I couldn’t afford to bring a camera bag with me. It protects it very well from scratches or dings or debris that might be floating around your backpack of suitcase, and it also is easy to take on and off. I love using it on trips where my camera will be around my neck most of the time as well, because I don’t have to worry about it bumping into things as I bend over and move around as much.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I don't review much but when I do its cause it's great!!! I haven't had a chance to use the product much. It feels like it protects my camera well. I love the colors and it has a much more durable feel to it then I thought it would by the photos. Good job on marketing the review. If I wasn't bothered by email to reivew I wouldn't have!! I also appreciate the confidence you guys have in your product that allows you to bother us for a review :)
customer_reviews.author: Chichi

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product for someone who doesn't like to carry a ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cute design. This is a great product for someone who doesn't like to carry a big camera bag around. It is a little difficult to get the camera in and out (I have a Canon rebel EOS), but the material is flexible enough to get it in.
customer_reviews.author: jh

customer_reviews.title: perfect for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I don't carry a bunch of accessories with me for photography so this was perfect. It protected the camera & had a small zipper pouch for extra memory cards. The velcro belt piece was great for when you were taking pictures, you could strap it to you so your hands were free for photos! Seems pretty durable too.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Canon Rebel T6 Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I think this is perfect for when you're just taking your camera out for a day or so and don't want to necessarily bring your other lenses, or accessories! It fits like a glove (Canon Rebel T6) so I feel like it is fairly protected in this! I also like that there are many design choices!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "Geometric" pics wrong
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the "Geometric" pattern & was expecting light neon colors. The pattern I received was so much darker & mostly red and the print doesn't look very clear. Returning anyways since I wanted to use this for traveling with my Sigma Art 18-35mm f/1.8 DC HSM lens but it doesn't fit. My Nikon D3500 body fits if I use the small lens it came with.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this because I was going to Ireland and I need something for my camera that would fit in my carry on that could be tight. This worked amazing; I wasn't worried when tossed it in my bag for the day. It was sleek and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Steele

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!
customer_reviews.text: I like this for travel or anytime because you can trow it in a backpack or lg purse & not worry about the camera getting beat up. The case is super light weight, stylish & protective. The only thing that I would like would be having a cord to attach to the camera strap, so you can quickly take the case off & shoot. But I can add that myself. I think the belt attachment is also good, but I don't wear belts often.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case
customer_reviews.text: I love this case so much that I bought a smaller one for my point and shoot. I am very picky with my expensive camera and this case meet every expectation. I also love the color. It makes my camera easy to spot and was nice to have on vacation where I was concerned that someone may try to take it.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie S.

customer_reviews.title: Cute and keeps camera safer
customer_reviews.text: Super cute galaxy design! Looks just as the pictures show. Fits my Nikon D3400 perfect! It is a little awkward/ does take a minute to get it in and out of the case, but it fits great once it’s in. This won’t protect your camera from drops, but keeps it safe from scratches, dings, ect. I also bought a screen protector for my camera, something else you may consider investing in :).
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Trimble

customer_reviews.title: Good but doesn't fit larger lenses
customer_reviews.text: This is well made, but it barely fits with my Nikon D3200 (a smaller body) and 18-140mm lens. I have to pull it really tight and the velcro barely meets but I am going to use it for this trip because I want extra padding for my camera when I put it down into my purse. I'm still going to be traveling with it in my small actual camera bag, but for walking around the city and taking photos, it's going in this little cover and into my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmie 06

customer_reviews.title: Light and protects your camera perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a light cover for my camera to travel. I didnt want to take with me the bulky one it came with the camera so I started looking... this is super light but thick enough to protect your camera, the camera was in the diaper bag for 3 weeks while traveling and the camera is still I perfect Condition! My cousin was looking for a camera cover too and i recommended her this and she loved it too! It was just what we were looking for our cameras!
customer_reviews.author: Lizbeth Avery

customer_reviews.title: Tight squeeze
customer_reviews.text: I got this to go with my new Sony Alpha a7ii for some security with minimal bulk for backpacking. I have two different lenses, when the Sony 24-240 F3.5 is attached it's a very tight squeeze but the neoprene is stretchy enough that I can close the velcro. I also have a prime lens, Rokinon 24mm F1.4 and I can't close the velcro when this lens is on. It would obviously be a more comfortable fit with a smaller lens, but not super versatile as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this on a trip to Hawaii, where I had to pack all of my belongings in a small carry on bag and needed my camera to take up less space. The case fit the camera well (I have a Nikon D3300) and kept it protected throughout the trip. I was able to stick it in my backpack during hikes, or even wear the camera around my neck without having to worry about dirt and dust. The case also has a small Velcro tab so you can attach it to your camera strap when you aren't using it. I would have given this five stars, but the case was a little difficult to get on and off quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Good padded, slim, camera case.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice came for my camera and seems to provide just enough protection, while staying slim, to keep this in my bag. My one complaint/negative is that it's a little bit of a tight fit for the back flap to close on my particular camera. I think it may stretch over time. My current camera is a Nikon D5600 and it seems to be the higher flash? keeping the back flap from easily being secured. Still was what I was looking for and meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: like my D7100
customer_reviews.text: I read on Amazon that this case will fit Nikon DSLR cameras... it does NOT fit my Nikon D7100. Why would anyone claim this case fits larger Nikons? like my D7100? Anyway, this does not fit my Nikon D7100. So back it goes.....Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: extra protection
customer_reviews.text: perfect for when you need a lens or two or are on vacation, you can throw it into a regular backpack and go. the little clip/carabiner flows you to clip it to a loop inside the backpack to keep it from rattling around while walking or moving the backpack around.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have a Canon EOS M50 and this case is a bit loose around it. I bought it knowing that though because this case was made for DSLRs, not mirrorless cameras. But the case is of great quality and I love the design. Great for some added protection while walking around taking pics. I plan on taking the case out while I go hiking so it's nice that it's lightweight. Note that the belt loop is not meant to be used to hold the camera weight (which they now have a warning that came with it), but more meant for attaching the empty case to your belt while you shoot something, like a place holder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this camera case!! It is lightweight yet protects my camera! Few downfalls but I knew that prior to purchasing...no room to store other lenses and the length is a bit shy for longer camera lenses. I usually keep 1-2 lenses with me and they both fit perfectly once on the camera. I love the small pocket where I can store extra memory cards. This case prevents me from having to lug around a huge camera bag (I'm no professional so why do I need all that extra stuff anyways)! AMAZING BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera Case!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Canon Rebel SL1 EOS 100D and found it difficult to find a protective case. This case is perfect! I fits well and the velcro closure works well too. It was also available in several colors. I have the light gray and it matches my camera to the T. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: GMan

customer_reviews.title: Not for Nikon D7100
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT fit Nikon D7100 even though this was indicted when purchased...
customer_reviews.author: 3 FINGER GUITAR GUY

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: If I could get this to fit with a standard 300 mm zoom lenses it would be perfect. Spent a week traipsing about with my camera in this and never worried about the safety of the camera. Very glad I bought this Just wish it would fit w the zoom lense
customer_reviews.author: E. Terrosa

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Quality camera case. Perfect size for my DSLR, with a small zipper pocket good for a spare battery or SD card. It only rained off & on sporadically, camera was safe and dry. I dont think I'd test it in a downpour, but it's thick, sturdy wet suit-type material.
customer_reviews.author: K. Grummel

customer_reviews.title: This was a perfect fit for my Canon Rebel T6 with a 55mm ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect fit for my Canon Rebel T6 with a 55mm lens on it. It has a small pocket on the top which you can fit an extra SD card. I tried to fit my battery but was unable to zip it at that point. It does not come with a strap but the strap from your camera easily hangs out for wear around the neck. It does come with a D ring which will allow you to clip on to a bag or pants while not in use. The quilted design gives it an extra pop!
customer_reviews.author: sLm

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: In the images on this listing it has a matching strap and DOES NOT state that the strap is not included. Received the case and there is no strap. So you mean to tell me I have to spend another $20 on the matching strap? This is trash and it will be getting returned. Cheap quality anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Imani Meeks

customer_reviews.title: Works but barely
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to protect my canon t3i after having a close call with the camera before, This looked like it would fit the bill but it's like trying to fit a person into clothes one size too small. It works but barely reaches the velcro. I'm using a t3i with a sigma f2.8 17-50 mm lens and the lens portion of the holster stretches to accommodate both body and lens, but the fit is a bit too snug for liking. I haven't any close calls with the camera yet so I wouldn't know how the holster does, but it is holding shape and does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great for storage, not for newer model camera
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great camera sleeve but doesn’t fit the camera I bought it for. It does fit an older model. It would be great for general use for storing your camera but the flap folds over and Velcro’s so there are open seems water could get in if exposed to a large amount of water. It might would keep condensation from a water bottle or something in a bag from harming your camera. Let me put it this way, I wouldn’t feel safe with my camera in just this riding Thunder River at six flags.
customer_reviews.author: Kara N.

customer_reviews.title: zipper broke on first try
customer_reviews.text: I love the case but my zipper broke on the small pocket. I have never unzipped it until today. I have had the product for about 2 months. I decided to try the zipper today and it zipped right off the case. I was hoping I could contact the manufacturer regarding this issue, but I'm not sure how to do that. If that hadn't broke, I would highly recommend this case. I love the streamline feel and ease of use. I hated carrying around a large case. This gives me protection without bulk. Unfortunately with the zipper broke, it breaks up some of the streamline feel, the little pocket kinda hangs open.
customer_reviews.author: MWB6

customer_reviews.title: cute and functional
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to take a giant camera bag everywhere on my trip, but I wanted to protect my nice camera from scratches/getting banged up. This was super cute and made everything slim enough to put in my purse and carry on. It seemed protective enough and I didn't have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: MY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect protection for a camera
customer_reviews.text: This case was perfect for my Rebel T6. There is room for my camera to have a longer lens, memory cards and a battery. It is easy to use and it feel great. I plan to order another one in a colorful print. I ordered the black. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Olga T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my trip to Europe. I didnt want to take my big canon bag and wanted something easy to carry in my bag while still protecting my camero. It did just that. Super great product. I especially like the clip that it comes with, I didnt have to worry about the case while i took pictures, I simply attached it to the strap of my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a lightweight protective cover. Used this while on vacation as I did not want to carry my larger bag. Small pocket is perfect size to carry ID/credit cards and some cash. While using camera, I attached it to neck strap with the belt loop. Using it for Nikon P900, fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Vita

customer_reviews.title: Not as useful as I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: It'll efficiently keep dust off your camera and insulate it from bumps. However, it's made of neoprene (like scuba wetsuits) and can't support the weight of the camera. You use your strap connections to the camera and remove the cover when needed. the clip on the bottom is just for attaching the (empty) sleeve to your belt. Not as useful as I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great! Good fit and quality. It allowed me to tote my camera around Ireland without having to carry my big camera bag and still have it protected to a point I was comfortable. There were other options out there that were big and bulky. I want d something that I could hen just put the camera in my backpack instead of carrying another heavy camera bag. Highly recommend. Please note that you do have to take your camera in and out which I was aware of when I bought and found no issues with that process at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda J Krauss

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Small
customer_reviews.text: I bought this style because it seemed thicker than the other colors. The bumps do seem like they'll add a little extra padding. I bought this intending to keep my camera in my backpack while traveling. It's good for that, but it's smaller than I expected. It just barely fits my Canon Rebel XSI with the standard 18-55mm lens, my smallest camera. It definitely wont fit over bigger cameras. If you use a strap that mounts to the camera stand hole, this won't work. It only works if you're using a strap that attaches in the standard spots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For What it Is
customer_reviews.text: A PERFECT fit for my Sony A7ii camera. I needed a small case that provides protection against bumps and scrapes. This fits inside my bigger briefcase, which I use at work, and works perfectly for that application. Especially nice is that it includes a small zippered compartment for a spare battery. Neat. This is VERY well made, and serves my purpose perfectly, but be aware that this will probably not provide ultimate protection for the camera from a hard fall onto concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Dean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for d3400 bag carrying
customer_reviews.text: For the Nikon d3400 with a short tonmid length lens I cannot say you will find a better carry sleeve. Perfect fit with a nice bit of padding. 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer 085

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Travel
customer_reviews.text: I love how the case hugs my Nikon D3500 camera but has enough cushion to protect the camera inside my purse. I took the case on an eight day trip to Scotland and it protected my camera from the rain, though the gaps by the opening could let water in but that can't really be helped. The little pouch in the back is the perfect spot for a SD card.
customer_reviews.author: Daydream Believer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Travel
customer_reviews.text: I normally refrained from being my expensive camera out while exploring new cities by foot. I didn't trust that it would be safe in my bag and didn't want to have to carry it everywhere. This was the perfect solution. Fit nicely in my bag and wasn't concerned about getting damaged. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Reed Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cover to give my Canon 80D extra protection while traveling by plane. It was easy to use and provided that extra layer of protection so I knew my camera would be safe in my backpack during travel. I was able to JUST FIT my camera with a 18-135 lens attached into this case. My daughter has a Sony A6300 and it fit easily with the same lens attached. Room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: Great protection but bad pocket zipper.
customer_reviews.text: Great protection, fits my D5300 with a 85mm 1.8g attatched and hot shoe for my tripod just fine. Only issue I have with it is the back pocket zipper comes open very easily. I routinely pull it out of my backpack and the zipper is open. I would not recommend storing anything in it like a flash drive or SD card as it will probably fall out. Minor detail but the color I got is very orange which is not a problem but I was a little surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Canon Rebel T7i perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love this skin for my Canon. The little pocket not the back fits my credit cards and ID perfect. I like to take my small back pack with beach blankets and other small items so its perfect to protect my camera in the backpack too.
customer_reviews.author: Jaminr

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Fit Sony a7R IV
customer_reviews.text: This camera case is really cute and seems to be good quality in person, however, it was too small for my Sony a7R IV - The Velcro would not stretch far enough back to keep the camera secure.
customer_reviews.author: Hello_Nikki

customer_reviews.title: light but protective
customer_reviews.text: My husband takes the train all the time for doctor's appointment so he takes his camera to add to his portfolio. The backpack didn't seem secure enough. He likes this a lot plus the design on the case makes him happy. He feels much better using this on his adventures.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Weingarten

customer_reviews.title: Not for DSLR!!!
customer_reviews.text: This did NOT fit my camera! I have both, the Canon 7D MK II and the 6D MK II, and neither camera fit in this thing! It didn’t matter what lens I had on it either. I do not recommend this for intermediate to advanced photogs.
customer_reviews.author: dodo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Case for Camera when doing a "walk about" tour and it is the heaviest of the styles offered I think.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to put my camera in during walk about tours and so I would not have to take my whole camera case. It worked with a camera slightly larger than the dimensions given in the ad. I think this is the best option of the various ways it can be ordered because the padding is very heavy and I do love it and will use it again.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Good Protection, Not the Best for Lumix GX85
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Lumix GX85 (with a longer lens) to protect my camera in my day pack while hiking. It's a little big, but it works ok. The neoprene is light, but the outside waffle pattern gives the holster a good layer of protection for my camera. I don't think it ideal for my Lumix, and I'm still looking for the right size, but in general, this would be good protection for a camera it fit better.
customer_reviews.author: Hiking Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Was too tight for my Nikon D5500 w/18 mm - 140 mm lens.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Nikon D5500 w/ 18 - 140mm lens. This is great feeling product, unfortunately, it was just too tight for my camera set up. I could barely Velcro it making it impossible to use the storage for anything bigger than a memory card. Depending on your needs, this could be a great solution for putting your camera in another bag. I just wanted something with more storage and the ability to separate the lens and body for longer trips.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Parker

customer_reviews.title: Protect your Camera....and Hip!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mainly to use as a protective cover to my camera and hip when I don't want to carry around my full camera bag and extra lenses. Wish it had a little more padding but it definitely does what it's supposed to do. I don't have to worry about my hip getting a continues bruise anymore or my camera screen on the back getting scratched.
customer_reviews.author: J.E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice medium level protection
customer_reviews.text: This fit so much better than expected! The Velcro straps could be more heavy duty to support the weight of a DSLR but other than that I really liked the case. I used it to protect my camera from (very light) drops of water from melting snow off roofs while walking around NYC. It's much easier to pop this on your camera to throw in your bag instead of bringing your entire camera case wherever you're heading! (I have a NIKON D3400)
customer_reviews.author: N. Peake

customer_reviews.title: This soft case is great! Very travel friendly
customer_reviews.text: This soft case is great! Very travel friendly. I don't like to take my bulky camera bag with me when traveling, so this soft case does the trick and i can put my camera in my backpack with no worries. It has a neat velcro strap that you can strap the case to your belt loop when you're not using it because you're busy taking photos.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

product_meta.title: USA GEAR FlexARMOR X DSLR SLR Camera Case Sleeve with Deluxe Padded Neoprene Protection, Carabiner Clip and Accessory Storage - Compatible with Nikon D3400, Canon EOS Rebel SL2, Pentax K-70 and More
product_meta.description:
Color:FlexARMOR XUSA Gear FlexARMOR X

Built for Tough Terrains
This new camera case features reinforced 6MM neoprene to provide greater protection for your camera. That is 50% thicker than most cases! The molded dense neoprene material is manufactured to absorb shock and protect from bumps and scratches. Be comfortable shooting in the mountains, while hiking or even maneuvering amongst a rowdy crowd at a concert!

Safeguards your Camera from the Inside
The conforming design of the case stretches over your camera's body and lens. The heavy-duty velcro closure keeps your camera secured for a tight connection and allows instant access to your device.

Getting that shot with Less Hassle
Use this FlexARMOR X case when you don't want to carry a hefty camera bag and need just the basic accessories. A zippered accessory pocket is included to store a battery or memory card. Attach the carabiner to your belt loop while shooting. If you are traveling lightly, simply throw this case in your suitcase.

Interior Dimensions: 6.5 x 6.25 x 3 inches

Compatible With:

Canon EOS 5DS , 5DS R , 7D Mark II , 70D , 700D , 6D , 60Da , 50D , 40D , 30D , 20D , 10D / Rebel T6 , T6i , T6s , T5 , T5i , T4i * , T3i , T3 , T2i , T1i , XS , XSi , XT , XTi

Nikon D3400 , D7200 , D5500 , D810 , Df , D7100 , D5300 , D5200 , D600 , D5100 , D5000 , D3300 , D3200 , D3100 , D3000 , D700 , D300S , D300 , D90 , D80 , D70 , D60

Pentax K-70 , K-3 II , K-S2 , K-S1 , K-3 , K-50 , K-500 , K-5 II , K-5 IIs , K-30 , K-01 , K-5 , K-r , K-x , K-7 , K-m , K2000 , K200D , K20D , K100D , K110D , K100D

Sony Alpha 7S II , 7R II , 7 II , 7S , 7R , 7 , SLT-A58 , SLT-A99 , A580 , A560 , SLT-A55 , SLT-A33 , A390 , A290 , A450 , A550 , A500 , A380 , A230 , A330

*Won’t fit Canon T4i with 18-135mm lens*
feature_bullets: FITS LIKE A GLOVE to protect your DSLR while allowing you to easily insert/remove your camera in the case. Formfitting DuraNeoprene case protects your camera while in your backpack
WORKS WITH A CAMERA STRAP and conforms to the body & standard-sized lens of your camera making it easy to carry when using the case *Matching Strap NOT Included*
SECURE AND STRONG carabiner clip allows you to attach the case to your belt loop while you are using your camera. *Not meant to hold the weight of your camera*

ROOM FOR EXTRAS with Zippered accessory pocket to hold small accessories such as memory cards, spare batteries and lens filters. Interior Dimensions of 6.5" x 6.25" x 3" *Measure Camera to ensure fit*
LIGHTWEIGHT, PREMIUM CONSTRUCTION is backed by the USA Gear 3-Year Manufacturer's Warranty!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,907 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
